content.description: This route climbs the right arete of The Scoop Wall. Climb up an obvious corner with an optional gear placement to a ledge with a Large birch tree. Clip a bolt and make hard moves up and left onto the face and clip a second bolt. (Help from the birch tree makes the route about 5.8 A0). Finish straight up with a small runout on easy terrain to a bolt anchor.

This route is located on a big scoop just behind The Outback. Start up blocky rock to a stance. Clip a bolt and make the surprisingly hard crux moves up onto a block. Go straight up past another bolt to a right leaning crack. Place gear or run it out to the top on easier climbing. Places to build a trad anchor on top or rap of the trees.
content.location: The Scoop behind The Outback Wall

content.description: the start is at the "fish flake" just around the corner from Animal. Climb the flake to gain a moderate face climb to a small roof where you can throw a good old knee bar and then you hit the crux, which is gaining the crimps/undercling finishing hold. use trees at top for anchor
content.protection: standard trad rack up to size 4 cams. use treest at top for anchor may want some static line to run it out
content.location: climbers left of Animal on the Scoop wall

content.description: Unleash your inner animal. Follow arete and face left of the shallow crumbly inside corner to a point where you can move right towards the soccer ball size hole through the roof of rock. Then move up to top out. Would get another star if the rock quality was better.
content.protection: There's ring anchors on a small section of rock above the last hole. Makes setting up a TR easy.
content.location: This is located in the Scoop area, to the left of Jedi Mind Tricks. The hole through the roof of rock at the top is an obvious feature.

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: This is a small area in front and to the left of the Outback Wall.
